results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long. In Greek language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Kangaroos
results.creator_credit: Langton Gould-Marks and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Wild Life”.
A study of the kangaroo as one of the oldest mammals in history. Describes other marsupials of similar type; discusses aspects of the male and female animal; explains how the young animal reaches the mother’s pouch after birth; mentions other types such as the paddy melon, the swamp wallaby, the pretty-faced wallaby and the tree kangaroo.

results.title: Kangaroos
results.brief_description: A study of the kangaroo and its habits. Shows activities of the herd, males fighting, protection of the young and foraging for food. No narration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Kangaroo Island
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Ron Lowe
results.brief_description: The Australian wildlife seen by visitors to Kangaroo Island, South Australia, is the subject of this award-winning film. Koalas, kangaroos, emus, pelicans and seals abound on this island sanctuary, completely unafraid of humans. Their daily activities form a fascinating study. Contains no commentary, only sounds of nature and background music composed by Bruce Smeaton. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Kangaroo Island
results.creator_credit: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau and J.A. Correll
results.brief_description: A day on the Island, starting with fish being landed at dawn from the Kingscote Jetty. Includes visits to the friendly seals at Seal Bay and the kangaroos and koalas at Flinders Chase, the Remarkable Rocks, lighthouses and beaches. Water-skiing at American River, swimming at Penneshaw and a poolside party in the evening.

results.title: Kangaroo creek gang: ...`do the right thing'
results.creator_credit: Kangaroo Creek Gang, Terry Watt and David Kefford
results.brief_description: An animated video which encourages primary school children to “Do the right thing’ when disposing of rubbish. Encourages children to place rubbish in bins and to sort for recycling. This video is part of a kit which includes an audiotape with songs and advice to teachers.

Episode number 19 of Series “People of the Australian western desert (A)”.

results.title: Kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Naked Country Productions, Ross Dimsey and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Kangaroo is D. H. Lawrence’s story of love, violence and political intrigue based on his personal experiences in Australia in 1922. In search of a freer, more tolerant world than Europe, in which to rebuild their marriage, famous writer Richard Somers and his wife Harriet come to Australia, where they meet Kangaroo, the charismatic leader of a secret fascist army, who attempts to seduce Somers into his ideas. When Somers refuses his friendship Richard and Harriet are threatened by the same crude, political thuggery which they believed they had left behind in Europe. Stars Colin Friels and Judy Davis who was awarded the Best Actress AFI Award for this role. Photography is by Dan Burstall.
